title.narrative: IR 2.2: ACCESS TO QUALITY COMMUNITY-BASE

description.narrative: Out of school girls and boys have improved access to quality community-based primary education in intervention areas, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys aged 4-14 years have equitable access to quality education with specific focus on vulnerable groups and disadvantaged areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Out of school girls and boys have improved access to quality community-based primary education in intervention areas

description.narrative: The number of Community Schools in Egypt increased from 4,780 in 2013/2014 to 5,000 in 2016/2017, including 99,475 and 123,672 children respectively. This increase did not absorb the number of out of school children, which amounts to 320,000 children. In 2017, the inauguration of new community schools was constrained. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:10/01/2018
